title: Birstwith Walks Walking Route

images.caption: View across playing fields at Birstwith. The goalposts have been taken down for the summer, so there is a clear view of grazing cattle and the village church on the hill.

description: This pretty village is located in the Harrogate district of North Yorkshire. Birstwith is a nice place to start a riverside walk around a lovely part of the Nidderdale AONB. Notable features in the village include an old mill, a weir, a picturesque mill race, an old packhorse bridge and the Station pub for refreshments. This circular walk uses part of the Nidderdale Way to visit neighbouring Hampsthwaite and Clint. The walk starts in the village where you can pick up the waymarked trail and follow it east to Hampsthwaite. After exploring the village the trail then heads north, crossing the river before coming to Clint. From here you head west, passing the remains of Clint Hall before returning to the village.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Station Hotel is a nice place to enjoy a rest and a meal after your walk. They serve good quality food in their AA certified restaurant and also provide rooms if you wish to stay in the area. The attractive stone pub has a cosy interior with roaring log fires. Parking is available and there is a lovely large garden area outside for warmer days. You can find them at postcode HG3 3AG for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The country trails make for a fine dog walk and the Station Hotel mentioned above is also dog friendly with water bowls available.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To continue your walking in the area head east to visit Ripley Castle. The 14th century castle is surrounded by some lovely grounds with an ornamental lake and deer park.

display_address: Wreaks Road, Birstwith, North Yorkshire, York and North Yorkshire, England, HG3 2NN, United Kingdom
